name: Aloo Sabzi
history: Aloo Sabzi is a staple in Indian cuisine, with variations found across different regions. It's a versatile and simple dish that highlights the flavor of potatoes.
description: Aloo Sabzi is a flavorful and hearty potato-based dish, often spiced with a mix of Indian spices. It's a simple yet satisfying dish that pairs well with bread or rice.

equipment.name: frying pan
equipment.description: For saut√©ing the spices and cooking the sabzi.

instructions.title: Boil the Potatoes
instructions.description: Peel and dice the potatoes. Boil them in a pot of water until they are tender but still hold their shape.

instructions.title: Prepare the Spice Mix
instructions.description: Heat oil in a frying pan. Add cumin seeds and mustard seeds. Once they start to crackle, add turmeric powder, coriander powder, garam masala, and red chili powder.

instructions.title: Cook the Sabzi
instructions.description: Add the boiled potatoes to the spice mix. Season with salt and stir well. Cook for a few minutes until the potatoes are coated with the spices.

instructions.title: Garnish and Serve
instructions.description: Garnish the Aloo Sabzi with chopped cilantro. Serve hot with bread or rice.

tips: Adjust the amount of chili powder according to your preference for heat.
Adding a splash of lemon juice can enhance the flavors.
variations: Dry Aloo Sabzi: Reduce the water for a less gravy-like consistency.
Aloo Sabzi with Peas: Add green peas during cooking for extra flavor and nutrition.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container and reheat before serving.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on the stove or in a microwave until hot.
presentationTips: Serve in a traditional Indian serving dish for an authentic experience.
Pair with roti or naan bread for a complete meal.
